thread.title: Kiwi drama Jean makes a perfect landing at New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards
thread.title_full: Kiwi drama Jean makes a perfect landing at New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards

author: SHAUN BAMBER
title: Kiwi drama Jean makes a perfect landing at New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards
text:
Kiwi drama Jean makes a perfect landing at New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards SHAUN BAMBER Last updated 14:06, February 28 2017 SUPPLIED 
As a finalist in nine categories, Kiwi drama Jean - starring Kate Elliott, pictured - may have set a record at this year's New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards. 
Looks like it was money well spent. 
The NZ On Air-funded Sunday Theatre drama Jean has been shortlisted in nine categories at the 2017 New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards. 
Based on the life of New Zealand aviator Jean Batten, Jean received $3,256,700 from NZ On Air, the largest sum the funding body has ever allocated to a one-off drama. SUPPLIED 
Jean Batten (Kate Elliott) waves to the crowd in the one-off Kiwi drama Jean. 
Now that investment has paid off, with Jean selected by the New York Festivals Grand Jury as a finalist in nine categories: Best Direction, Best Screenplay, Best Actress, Best Camerawork, Best Original Music, Best Visual Effects, Best Sound, Best TV Movie and Best Drama Special. 
READ MORE: * Thames extras help Jean Batten tele-movie come to life 
"I think that's a record for one production," says Jean producer Paula Boock. "It's pretty special, and since we have no New Zealand television awards anymore, these international competitions really help in getting recognition for excellence and overseas sales for our productions." SUPPLIED 
Celebrated New Zealand aviator Jean Batten with Buddy the cat, who was her flying companion in 1934. 
NZ On Air head of communications Allanah Kalafatelis was equally thrilled at the news. 
"Obviously we're delighted, because it's always a reinforcement of the quality of New Zealand drama when it gets recognised overseas." 
With regard to NZ On Air's investment in Jean , Kalafatelis said the international recognition was "fantastic," labelling it "the proof in the pudding". SUPPLIED 
Kate Elliott has received a best actress nomination for her performance as Jean Batten in Jean. 
Last year's winners at the New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards include Westside , which brought home a gold world medal, and Rachel Hunter's Tour Of Beauty , Gloriavale and Te Mana O Te Moana - The Pacific Voyagers , all of which won silver world medals. 
Directed by Robert Sarkies ( Scarfies , Out Of The Blue ) and starring Kate Elliott ( Shortland Street, Bliss ) as Jean Batten, Jean screened on TVNZ 1 last October. TVNZ 
Kiwi Jean Batten biopic a finalist in nine categories at prestigious international film and television awards. - Stuff
